comments.commentBody: This was mentioned in the article. There is a small dedicated chip that does nothing but listen for the phrase "ok google now" ... and it doesn't take as much battery as you would expect.
It apparently has a dedicated processor for that function, making the impact on battery life negligible (at least, according to other reviews I've read).

Motorola claims that the core responsible for listening to your voice is extremely power-efficient, and they claim that their battery lasts a full 24 hours with average usage. I can't verify the accuracy of that claim because I don't have the phone.

Well, at least they tried.

The Voice Search feature has been available for a while. But it used a lot of battery. How's the battery on this thing, when it's always listening to ambient noise?

heard a rumor that they are skipping 4.3 and going straight to 5.0 when it is released this fall/winter (whether that is true or not doesn't matter)

the real point is that moto is not given special permission like the author assumes they do. The moto X was announced before 4.3, thus it was built, tested, and shipped with 4.2.2. i'm pretty confident that if the first rumor i mentioned is untrue that it will get a 4.3 update very soon.

"...because this is a Google phone you'll be able to upgrade it promptly..."

Really? The Moto X comes with Android 4.2.2. The latest version of Android is 4.3, already shipping on the Nexus 7, but you can't upgrade the Moto X to it.
You don't think aesthetics and personal choice are a remarkable aspect of this phone?

The author lost credibility and I almost quit reading the article when the first 2 features were about the color of the phone.
It looks to be a good phone, I'll wait for a bigger model that might replace my Note 2.
God, you don't know what you're talking about! You haters are always talking with your emotions instead of the facts.  Taxpayers, taxpayers.  Don't subsidize this!

Sure can! The brilliant mr. bush! Swindled again!  How Long! How  LONG! will this lack of empathy go on? Greed and selfishness just don't work. never has. never will! with all that hate for helping others and squirrelling away your few nuts, how do you and your children live with yourself and what are you raising to live with the next generation? A bunch or greedy, gluttonous, Ann Ryan think alikes?

Any subsidy to renters ultimately becomes a transfer payment to landlords. People will use subsidies to move into better rentals, just like homeowners do with their subsidies, driving prices up for the whole rental market--ultimately benefiting landlords in the form of higher rent.

No question, Raines has his hand deeply into the pie that soured for all but himself. Jail has not been an Obama option for  Raines or anyone. Itmisvwhy O has soured in so many minds, not that he cares.
Are you insane? How could I possibly carry a 1 gallon container of water with me while walking my dog? I clean up after all my dogs, but carrying water is absurd.

I've never even heard of carrying a bottle of water around with you to wash down dog pee until these comments. It's not laziness. It seems a kind of absurd idea to me to carry around bottles (or gallons) of water while walking your dog, and trying to avoid people, kids, strollers, etc. But then again, I don't live in NYC. Glad for it, too.

Dog owners are totally at the mercy of a barking dog. Some of them, dogs that is, are beyond influencing; as are some dog owners. I complained to a neighbor once about her Rottweiler, barking outside, at six in the morning. "Yes, but doesn't it give you a feeling of security?" WHA? I just doggie-sat my daughter's hybrid pooch.  Something like a Borgi,(corgi and boston terrier), or even better, a Boston Cattle Dog?!?( Australian cattle dog & Boston terrier). I can just see them up in Harvard Square, rounding up the Phd's in Lit. Anyway this little dog cured my wife and me from ever wanting a dog again. Dogs do what they can, and that's Bark; do you really want to hear them sing instead? Like covers of "Cattle Call," or "Stand By Your Man?" Woof! Maybe I'll get a pony...AC

Hedgiemom - wow, I thought we had rude, nasty neighbors in NY! Sorry you have to go through this. I wonder if people would be so cavalier if they were confronted with a young, large, angry man.

You mention a fence - do you have a fence around your entire property? Can anything be done about the easement?

Perhaps you could put up security cameras - and large signs stating "Private Property - Keep Out - No Dogs" and "Warning - Surveillance"

Here's a link to ways to repel dogs from your property - hope this helps:
http://www.wikihow.com/Discourage-Dogs-from-Pooping-in-Your-Garden

Ralph's valiant effort to smear his political enemies ran into a problem: most 1%ers made their own money. The Left insists that its acolytes teach the class struggle and that all wealth is inherited, but in a capitalist country, nothing could b e further from the truth.

The great, great majority of millionaires come out of the working and middle class. Feel free to envy their willingness to risk their homes, free time, health, and even family time to make their business work, but it's shocking how few of the people the American Lleft hates were just handed their cash in wills and such.

Oddly, Paris Hilton isn't burned in effigy any more. Perhaps some coolness has been alotted her by our munificent culture.

@Andy Hain: if you cannot see the difference between Zenger and Payne on the one hand, and Bezos on the other, then you are most likely not paying attention.
http://emcphd.wordpress.com

Actually, I misread the sentence. Stupid idiot that I am, I actually thought it read "fought FOR higher taxes on wealthy people."

I should have known better.

PS: The current crop of libertarians ARE anarchists, who would institute the same kind of government as China or Russia, here in the U.S., if given a chance.

Let's not let them.

More accurately, if the mean consumption of fruits and vegetables increased by one serving, then the population cardiovascular risk would be reduced by 5%, up to a certain threshold.

It's impossible to extrapolate these kinds of statistics to individuals. However, since he is talking about agricultural subsidy, you would expect the public policy to have effect on the market/population level, so what is written is appropriate.

I've changed my diet's composition, not tweaked it, to 90% vegetable and a little fruit. (Surprisingly delicious.) The rest is oil, meat, dairy, etc. Practically no sugar. I eat a lot. I'm never hungry. In 18 months I've gone from 240 to 192. Can you please explain how this is 'second order nonsense'?

Given the relatively low caloric values associated with vegetables and fruits compared to junk food subsidized by those pesky farm subsidies, it should be obvious to most people that increasing intake of vegetables and fruit will ultimately result in a reduction in obesity. One of the problems we have in this country, particularly among those who are food insecure, is the low cost of low-quality, energy-dense junk food while fresh, healthy produce can be rather expensive, particularly in food deserts where many of those poor, obese women live.  As to the recommendations made above, these are hardly recommendations from "ill designed studies", as the concept that we should eat more vegetables and fruit and less junk food is hardly "new".  As to your comments about mortality going down to zero with 20 servings of fruits and vegetables, all I can say is that you apparently have no understanding of statistics, particularly survival analysis, which necessarily involves more than multiplying 5% times 20 to obtain the observed reduction in mortality from cardiovascular disease, not to mention the fact that an increase of 20 servings per day likely falls well outside the parameters of the analysis so that such an inference is absurd.  But hey, you managed to express a little sarcasm while demonstrating how little that you understand about obesity, nutrition, cardiovascular disease, and biostatistics all at once.

Weirded Academic: As any good bridge player will tell you, you play the hands you're dealt and you play them the way they should be played if you want to maximize your chances of winning.

I know with 100% certainty that I will die at some point in the future. Hopefully you've reached a similar level of understanding. The point of the article is that by eating better you have a much higher chance of living well and then dying on your terms. Is that "guaranteed" by the statistics cited? No, but what in life is?

Does that piece tell me that if I eat 20 servings a day of fruit and vegetables my CVD mortality goes to zero? If not, how is it relevant?

Anyway, this is all second order nonsense. If you want people to be healthy given that the current American woman is about as fat as a walrus (don't believe me? walrus = 30% fat, American woman = 35% fat), the man as heavy as a lion seal, they should first and most importantly eat less of everything until they reach the desired fat percentage.

After we've achieved that, we can worry about tweaking the dietary composition, without promising incredible improvements in disease risk that are mostly derived from ill designed studies.

But what can you expect from the columnist who was willing to declare that Alzheimer is a form of diabetes.

Cynthia, I would expect them to obey the law. If I were a shareholder, I would be furious to see the CEO and his underlings blow away a huge chunk of *my* money by behaving so recklessly. Assuming they even consulted their attorneys before beginning this misadventure, any attorney worth ten cents would have told them they were playing with fire.

What he said is that if everyone ate the recommended amount of fruits and veggies that the estimated number of deaths from CVD would be reduced by 100,000 from 750,000, or 13.3 per cent.

He did not say that ingesting additional amounts of these foods would further decrease the risk beyond that number or anything about a given individual's risk. Epidemiological studies often to do not correlate precisely for any one individual. For instance, not every person who smokes cigarettes develops lung cancer and staying away from tobacco does not guarantee you will never get lung cancer --but, on average, smokers suffer from it more often.

I am not aware of any data showing that eating fruit can cause Type 2 diabetes. It is true diabetics and have to watch their fruit, but the risk of developing diabetes from eating fruit within the guidelines discussed in the article is probably close to zero.

If you don't brush and floss your teeth it's not the author's fault.

Every political pundit from newsprint to TV has said that Obamacare gave rise to the Tea Party. White House "insiders" said Axelrod and Obama didn't take the Tea Party seriously and went ahead with Obamacare. Talk about not having you finger on the pulse!!! Obamacare should have waited until after the midterm elections. Do you remember Pelosi telling Congress to vote for it even if it met losing the elections in their own districts?? Boy was she right about that!!!

The first stimulus wasn't enough if you recall and that's why it was "the first".

Look, I voted for Obama the first time and held my nose the 2nd time when I voted for him. I never believed he walked on water or blue "Disney Birds" made sweet music circling around his head. He has proven to be a neoliberal in my eyes. Not saying Hillary would have been better, but I do think she would have concentrated on bringing down unemployment first and foremost. And she would have made sure the midterm elections went Democratic!!

But Maureen did do a hatchet job on Hillary during the primaries.

@Linda: "Every political pundit from newsprint to TV has said that Obamacare gave rise to the Tea Party."

Wrong again. The Tea Party was sparked by Rick Santelli's rant in February 2009 on MSNBC. It was a protest over bailing out the "losers" who entered into bad mortgages and, as he saw it, caused the financial crisis. At that point, no one was talking about health care reform.

But that's beside the point. Why should good public policy be derailed by an extremist wing in the GOP? What, they were supposed to stop moving on health care reform because the Tea Party didn't like it?
You have no idea what should would have done. More likely, she would have bombed Iraq into oblivion.

If they really want to see some anti-Hillary in the media, I recommend reading Maureen's columns during the primaries. I don't remember one kind thing written. But I do remember Maureen's column helped catapult Obama to fame.

I have no idea if Hillary would be a great president, but I think she would have concentrated on the economy first which would have resulted in a win for Democrats in the midterm elections. Obamacare unfortunately gave rise to a constituency of hatred.
A tempest in a Tea-pot (pun intended).  Reince Priebus needs to settle down.

Wait, did you forget the dozens of anti-Bush movies Hollywood produced? There was one called "W" that was a real humdinger. Democrats think it's their natural right to have Democrats all be sexy superstars in every movie, while Republicans are portrayed as villains. Dems get super peeved when anybody gives them a taste of their own medicine.
Dozens? Name two.

Dagmar,
An excellent point, but Republicans don't understand irony. If they did, however, they would be more likely to understand rich irony than poor irony.

Does Reince understand the rich irony in that Citizens United was based on a movie slandering Hillary that the Republicans wanted to air in 2008?

So, if I understand Reince correctly, he is fine with a movie about Hillary, as long as it is critical about her. But aren't Reince and the Republicans trampling on the First Amendment Rights of corporations? Wasn't that what the conservatives ruled in Citizens United, i.e. that the First Amendment prohibits the government from restricting political independent expenditures by corporations?

This is so entertaining.

As badly as Putin treats gays and dissenters, our good friends treat them worse in Saudi and many other places.

As bad as Assad is, the rebels we support are worse. These are not democracy advocates, they are Islamist terrorists, and the very same men we were trying to kill in other countries. We'd try to kill them if they visited their homes.

Putin is correct that what we are doing in Syria will not take us or anyone else to anyplace we want to go. It is a more immediate danger to Putin's Russia, because of its Muslim regions relatively near to this. Still, al Qaeda has hurt us already, and supporting it is crazy.

There are not reasons to turn away from one of the world's great powers. We may not need him or Russia, but we would be far better off with a better relationship with both. So would our friends be better off if we had that to work with.

A stunning agenda for President Obama in the Muslim world.
The plan is not to make it more solvent, it is to shift public pension money, something they do not believe in, to their overlords.

Why add the cost of a private insurer's profit to the struggling pension plans of local governments ?   If a local government refuses to properly fund its pension plans, why is adding a cost of 10% (private insurer profit) going to make the plan more solvent ?
I thought the stimulus was concentrating on the economy!
